title: Dallas: Indian-origin man beheaded at motel in front of wife & son; suspect arrested
content: In a shocking incident at a Dallas motel, 50-year-old Chandramouli Nagamallaiah, an Indian-origin man, was brutally beheaded in front of his family. The suspect, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a motel employee, has been arrested and charged with capital murder. The gruesome attack reportedly stemmed from a dispute over a broken washing machine.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Fresh surveillance images of ‘person of interest’ released
content: Utah authorities have released more close-up images of a person of interest in the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk, a Donald Trump ally, at Utah University. The FBI is offering a $100,000 reward for information leading to the suspect's arrest. Kirk was shot while attending an event, and videos show a dark figure on a rooftop.

title: Sikkim landslide: Four dead, three missing in Yangthang; rescue ops under way
content: A devastating landslide in Upper Rimbi, West Sikkim, claimed the lives of at least four people and left three others missing. The tragedy struck early Friday in Yangthang constituency, prompting a swift response from police, SSB personnel, and local villagers. Rescue efforts are ongoing to find the missing individuals amidst challenging conditions.

title: Asia Cup: 'We have best spinner in the world' – Pakistan coach fires warning at India
content: As Pakistan gears up for the Asia Cup, coach Mike Hesson acknowledges India's confidence and strength, particularly their world-class spinners. He emphasizes Pakistan's focus on improving daily, highlighting the team's strong bowling attack led by Mohammad Nawaz. While recognizing the batting lineup's development, Hesson stresses the importance of collective performance in adapting to varying conditions in Dubai.

title: Charlie Kirk’s shooting: Video spreads on social media; How tech giants reacted
content: Following the tragic shooting of Charlie Kirk, graphic videos rapidly spread across social media platforms like X, YouTube, and Meta's platforms, amassing millions of views. This widespread dissemination has ignited renewed debate over content moderation policies. Platforms are responding with varied approaches, from warning labels to content removal and age restrictions, highlighting the ongoing challenge of managing violent content online.

title: Cricket: How Peaky Blinders and a journalist’s jab fired up Gill at Edgbaston - details inside
content: In the summer of 2025, Shubman Gill led India to their first Test victory at Edgbaston, overcoming the weight of past failures. A journalist's question about India's poor record at the venue fueled Gill's determination. His match-winning innings not only secured the win but also etched Birmingham as a special chapter in his cricketing journey.

title: ‘He was murdered’: Musk’s reply to Altman who called OpenAI researcher’s death 'suicide'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said Suchir Balaji's death was a suicide. He mentioned Balaji worked at OpenAI. Altman's statement followed the researcher's death in San Francisco last year. Balaji's parents had earlier dismissed suicide claims. Elon Musk reacted sharply to Altman's remarks. Musk alleged Balaji was murdered. The exchange occurred during an interview with Tucker Carlson.

title: The Bengal Files Day 7: Vivek Agnihotri's film wraps up first week; earns Rs 11 crore in India
content: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files,' starring Mithun Chakraborty and Anupam Kher, earned Rs 11.25 crore in its first week, with overseas collections adding Rs 2.50 crore. Day 7 saw approximately Rs 1 crore in domestic earnings. While the film's box office performance lags behind Agnihotri's previous hits like 'The Kashmir Files,' it has surpassed 'The Vaccine War.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: 'He woke me up at 3 for practice': Gill reveals; claims his father’s sacrifices shaped him
content: Shubman Gill's journey from a Punjab farm to leading India in Tests is a testament to his father's unwavering belief and sacrifices. Recognizing his son's talent at a young age, his father moved the family to Chandigarh and created rigorous training schedules.

title: Bolsonaro sentenced to 27yrs: Brazil's SC convicts ex-president for coup attempt
content: Jair Bolsonaro, the former president of Brazil, has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison after being convicted by the Supreme Court for attempting a coup following his 2022 electoral defeat. The unprecedented ruling has sparked international backlash, particularly from the US, while inflaming political tensions within Brazil, with supporters claiming political persecution. Despite the ruling, Bolsonaro remains an influential figure.

title: 'We don’t earn big': Gabrielle Union on Hollywood pay gap; Wade supports her
content: Gabrielle Union, actress and wife of Dwyane Wade, recently discussed her financial concerns despite her successful career and her husband's NBA fame. She highlighted the necessity of multiple income streams for actors, as paychecks are often split and not as substantial as perceived. Union also mentioned how financial considerations sometimes limit her ability to participate in independent film projects.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Patrick Mahomes quiet; Randi Mahomes, Tavia Hunt speaks out
content: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: JJ McCarthy, Katya Kuropas at hospital; Vikings QB celebrates win; baby due soon
content: J.J. McCarthy, the Vikings' quarterback, is experiencing a monumental week as he and his fiancee, Katya Kuropas, prepare for the arrival of their first child. This joyous occasion coincides with McCarthy's impressive NFL debut, where he earned NFC Offensive Player of the Week honors after leading the Vikings to a comeback victory against the Chicago Bears.

title: 'Your man said it was worth it': Panthers staffer mocks Charlie Kirk death; sparks outrage
content: Following the assassination of Charlie Kirk, Carolina Panthers PR staff member Charlie Rock posted insensitive content on social media, including an old video of Kirk and a song interpreted as a dig at his murder. This sparked immediate outrage, leading the Carolina Panthers to swiftly terminate Rock's employment.

title: Ritika Sajdeh pens teary-eyed note for Rohit Sharma: 'Goosebumps and ... ' - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma's return to the nets, as seen in a recent Instagram video posted by the batter, has ignited excitement among fans, further amplified by his wife Ritika Sajdeh's emotional comment. After a break from international cricket and a recent fitness test, Rohit is set to play in the upcoming ODI series against Australia.

title: Asia Cup: 'Play hard, play fair' - Rahane hails Surya’s sportsmanship
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 began with a dominant win over UAE, but Suryakumar Yadav's sportsmanship stole the show. He withdrew a run-out appeal, earning praise from Ajinkya Rahane, who highlighted the gesture's significance. Rahane also commented on team balance, noting Arshdeep Singh's absence and suggesting his inclusion alongside Bumrah for quality pace bowling against stronger opponents later in the tournament.

title: ‘Will sort out with India’: Trump official confident of deal; ‘stop Russia oil buys’
content: Amid ongoing trade negotiations between India and the US, optimism is growing, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing confidence in reaching an agreement if India liberalizes its markets and ceases Russian oil imports.

title: Gabrielle Union: Dad’s hospital bills expose an insurance gap
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union spoke about managing money. She highlighted hospital expenses and insurance issues. Union mentioned her father's memory care costs. She also spoke about choosing roles based on financial needs. Dwyane Wade's net worth is $170 million. Gabrielle Union's net worth is $40 million. They share expenses equally. The couple has been together for over ten years.

title: IND vs PAK: Afridi revives 'one bad egg' row; jibe at players 'proving Indian'
content: Shahid Afridi's recent remarks have ignited controversy ahead of the highly anticipated India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash. Afridi criticised former Indian players for withdrawing from a previous match, alleging ulterior motives and nationality assertions. With political tensions already heightened by recent events, his comments add fuel to the fire, promising an emotionally charged encounter in Dubai.

title: Kawhi chose Clippers over Lakers to avoid LeBron and $28M payout
content: In 2019, Kawhi Leonard chose the Los Angeles Clippers over the Lakers. Reports suggest he avoided playing with LeBron James. He preferred being the main leader. Later, a controversy emerged regarding Leonard's deal with Aspiration. Allegations arose of a scheme to bypass the NBA salary cap. Steve Ballmer denied any involvement. The NBA is investigating the matter.

title: 'Male, college-aged': FBI briefs on Kirk’s assassin; what we know about the shooter
content: Authorities are actively searching for the gunman responsible for the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk, a prominent ally of Donald Trump, during a campus event at Utah Valley University. The attack, which Utah's governor has condemned as a political assassination, prompted a lockdown of the university as investigators scour for evidence. President Trump has vowed to find those responsible for the tragedy.

title: 'I am here again': Rohit Sharma shows readiness in energetic net session – Watch
content: Rohit Sharma is gearing up for the ODI series against Australia, marking his return to international cricket after seven months. He shared a video of his net session, showcasing his form and fitness. Recent concerns arose from a hospital visit, but he has since cleared a fitness test.

title: Charlie Kirk murder: Shooter caught on cam? FBI releases photos of 'person of interest'
content: The FBI has released the first photos of the alleged assassin of Charlie Kirk. They are seeking public assistance in identifying the person. Kirk, the CEO of Turning Point USA, was shot while addressing students at Utah Valley University. Tributes have poured in from figures like Donald Trump and Barack Obama. Flags will be flown at half-staff.

title: Why Nepal unrest looks familiar: Echos of B'desh, Sri Lanka & fears of larger plot
content: Nepal faces political turmoil as Prime Minister Oli resigns amidst Gen Z-led protests against corruption. Echoes of unrest in Bangladesh and Sri Lanka are noted, with concerns of external forces exploiting the situation. While some see parallels to past South Asian uprisings, others highlight Nepal's unique context and geopolitical vulnerabilities, urging caution in assigning blame.

title: Charlie Kirk’s assassination: What it means for Trump - and a divided America
content: Charlie Kirk, leader of Turning Point USA, died after being shot at Utah Valley University. The incident occurred during a Q&A session. Investigation is underway. Political reactions are divided. Some condemn the violence. Others point fingers. Kirk's death sparks debate about free speech and political polarization. Concerns arise about potential misuse of the tragedy and retaliatory violence.

title: 'India is one of top relationships': Rubio on ties; backs Sergio Gor
content: US State Secretary Marco Rubio emphasized the paramount importance of the US-India relationship, highlighting it as a top priority for America's future. He introduced Sergio Gor, the US ambassador-designate to India, noting Gor's close ties to President Trump.

title: Judge belts 2 HRs, ties DiMaggio on Yanks' list
content: Just two days after passing Yogi Berra on the Yankees' all-time home run list, Aaron Judge hit two home runs Thursday to tie Joe DiMaggio for fourth with 361 career home runs.

title: Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clippers partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: Trump attends Yankees game on 9/11 anniversary
content: Security at Yankee Stadium will be tight with President Donald Trump attending Thursday's game to mark the 24th anniversary of the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: Costa Rica hotel raided in Gardner investigation
content: Authorities in Costa Rica on Thursday raided the hotel in which the 14-year-old son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner was found dead.

title: NCAA: 13 players at 6 schools in gambling plots
content: The NCAA says 13 men's college basketball players from six schools were involved in gambling schemes, including point shaving and game manipulation.

title: NHL: Hockey Canada players can return Dec. 1
content: The NHL says the five players acquitted of sexual assault charges stemming from an alleged incident in 2018 will be eligible to sign a contract Oct. 15 and play Dec. 1.

title: Ex-NBA C Collins in treatment for brain tumor
content: Jason Collins, the NBA's first openly gay player who played through the 2013-14 season, is undergoing treatment for a brain tumor, his family said in a statement through the league.

content: Minnesota, Las Vegas, Atlanta, Phoenix, New York, Golden State, Indiana and Seattle are in the playoffs.

content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts on the Canelo Alvarez-Terence Crawford fight and explains how they can win.

title: Chelsea FC's 74 charges explained: What are they accused of? What punishment could they face?
content: Chelsea FC have been charged with 74 breaches of FA rules relating to alleged agent payments. But what exactly are they accused of, and what could it cost them?

title: 'I think the players knew it was important': How the U.S. is using this week in Napa to prepare for the Ryder Cup
content: With the Ryder Cup just a few weeks away, U.S. captain Keegan Bradley is using this week's PGA Tour event in Napa as a tuneup for what's ahead at Bethpage Black.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Will Silva end the Fighting Nerds' losing streak at Noche UFC?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the Noche UFC main event between Diego Lopes and Jean Silva. Ian Parker gives his value picks for the card.

title: Vikings QB J.J. McCarthy leaves team to accompany fiancée Katya Kuropas in child's birth
content: The Minnesota Vikings quarterback left the team on Thursday to be with his fiancée ahead of their child's birth.

title: Should you bet on Mateer or Moore to win the Heisman?
content: As odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: Fantasy Basketball 101: Why this is the year to play, even if you never have before
content: Thinking about trying out fantasy basketball for the first time this season? Here is everything you need to know, so you can join in on the fun.

title: The John Cena eras: From Ruthless Aggression to 17-time WWE champ
content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

title: The strangely specific transfer obsessions of elite clubs, and what the summer window taught us about them
content: Every team has preferences when it comes to transfers ... but some are more surprising than others. What did we learn this summer about Real Madrid's, Arsenal's and other elite clubs' fixations?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid eye move for Stuttgart's Stiller
content: Real Madrid are reportedly keeping tabs on a possible move for VfB Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller.

title: Who's the No. 1 player in the girls' 2026, 2027 and 2028 classes?
content: Are Saniyah Hall, Kaleena Smith and Tatianna Griffin safe at No. 1 in the 2026, 2027 and 2028 classes, respectively?

title: Hall of Fame inductee Carmelo Anthony's NBA 2K ratings through the years
content: For Carmelo Anthony's induction into the Basketball Hall of Fame, here's a look at how much of a force he was throughout NBA 2K.

title: Trump Urges Peaceful Response To Charlie Kirk's Killing Amid Ongoing Manhunt
content: President Donald Trump urged supporters Thursday to respond peacefully to the killing of right-wing campaigner Charlie Kirk, as the murderer continued to evade a manhunt more than 24 hours after the shooting put an already divided US on edge.

title: Russia Says Ukraine Drones Hit Training Centre At Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Site
content: Ukrainian drones attacked a training centre at the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant on Thursday, the Moscow-installed administration of the Russia-held plant in Ukraine said.

title: US-Backed Brazil's Bolsonaro Sentenced To 27 Years In Jail In Coup Case
content: He has a long history of homophobic, misogynistic and racist comments delivered in a belligerent, everyman style which endeared him to many.

title: Charlie Kirk's Shooting Death Exposes Security Gaps At Political Events
content: The assassination of Charlie Kirk offers the latest example of how ordinary security measures can be defeated in an era of escalating political violence, when anyone associated with the political process is a potential target, including influencers.

title: Brazil Supreme Court Convicts Ex-President Jair Bolsonaro In Coup Case
content: Brazil's Supreme Court on Thursday reached the majority of three votes needed to convict firebrand ex-president Jair Bolsonaro of plotting a coup, making a lengthy prison sentence a near certainty.

title: Kash Patel Faces Scrutiny For Mistakenly Detaining Man In Charlie Kirk Case
content: Kash Patel faced his biggest test yet as FBI director as current and former officials criticized his inaccurate statement that a suspect had been caught in the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, a prominent ally of President Trump.

title: Infosys Board Approves Record Rs 18,000-Crore Share Buyback Program
content: IT services giant Infosys on Thursday said its board has approved the company's largest-ever share buyback programme worth Rs 18,000 crore.

title: New York Marks 9/11 Attacks Against Divided Backdrop
content: New York on Thursday marked the devastating attacks of September 11, 2001, 24 years after the plane hijackings that claimed almost 3,000 lives and forever changed the United States.

title: Trial Begins For Man Accused Of Golf Course Plot To Kill Trump
content: The trial of a man charged with plotting to shoot Donald Trump on a Florida golf course during last year's election campaign began in earnest Thursday after three days of jury selection.

title: Ticket To The Arctic: Inside Russia's System Of Convict Labour
content: It was a mild spring evening in the Russian city of Krasnoyarsk, but Yekaterina Fatyanova was scrambling to pack winter clothes.

title: Peter Navarro Tried To Start Fight Between Trump, PM Modi: Ex US NSA
content: Peter Navarro, the trade advisor of Donald Trump, had once tried to start a fight between the US President and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, John Bolton, the former National Security Advisor of the US, told NDTV today.

title: US Will Sort Out India Deal After It Stops Buying Russia Oil: Top US Official
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has said that Washington will "sort out" the trade deal with India but once New Delhi stops buying Russian oil and opens up their market.

title: Not Far Apart On Trade Deal With India: Trump's Ambassador Pick At US Senate
content: US President Donald Trump's nominee for the country's ambassador to India, Sergio Gor, has said that Washington and New Delhi are not "that far apart right now" on the trade deal.

title: NDTV Impact: Mangaluru's "Highway To Hell", Where Woman Died, To Be Repaired
content: Mangaluru's "Highway to hell" -- a crumbling stretch of National Highway 66 near Kulur where a pothole-related crash cost a life this week- will be repaired. This was the second accident on this stretch within a month.

title: Charlie Kirk Assassination Updates: Trump Ally Charlie Kirk's Assassin Still At Large, Manhunt Underway
content: Charlie Kirk Assassination Updates: Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist and close ally of US President Donald Trump, was shot dead at a Utah college event.

title: 62-Year-Old Man Trampled To Death By Wild Elephant In Maharashtra Forest
content: A 62-year-old man was trampled to death by a wild elephant in eastern Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, a forest official said on Thursday.

title: Omar Abdullah Government Slammed By Own Party's Srinagar MP
content: In a sharp criticism of his own party, National Conference (NC) parliamentarian Aga Syed Ruhullah Mehdi has accused the party leadership of compromising dignity and failing to fight for Jammu and Kashmir's statehood and constitutional rights.

title: French Doctor Accused Of Serial Poisonings Was At First 'Above Suspicion'
content: A French doctor accused of intentionally poisoning 30 child and adult patients, 12 of whom died, was "above suspicion" at the start of a probe in 2017, an investigator said on Thursday.

title: Delhi Considers Lowering Legal Age For Drinking Beer From 25 To 21
content: The Delhi government is considering lowering the legal age of drinking beer from 25 to 21, aiming to align the National Capital with neighbouring states and curb the sale of unregulated alcohol.

title: Russia Dismisses Polish Statements On Drones In Its Airspace As 'Nothing New'
content: The Kremlin on Thursday dismissed statements by Warsaw and other European countries about the shooting down of Russian drones over NATO member state Poland as nothing new and said that Moscow would be making no further comment on the situation.

title: Uttar Pradesh Congress president alleges house arrest during PM Modi’s Varanasi tour
content: Around 100 Congress and Samajwadi Party (SP) workers were also put under house arrest in Varanasi to stop a proposed protest against alleged vote fraud in the Prime Minister’s presence in Varanasi.

title:
Tracing the history of colonial powers
in Tamil land through charts, maps
content: European sailors prepared maps and diagrams mainly for space and direction. But they have so far remained unused. Recently, 1,862 maps of forts, armouries, granaries, mints, and treasuries — selected from the Tamil Nadu State Archives — have been uploaded on Tamil Digital Library. They will be the invaluable resources for researchers

title: The caste tensions that sparked after T.N. Scheduled Caste activist Immanuel Sekaran’s murder in 1957
content: The events, starting with riots at Mudukulathur, continue to dominate the public discourse. While the Scheduled Castes were among the adversely impacted people, police firing at Keezhathooval, wherein five persons belonging to the Mukkulathors were killed, confounded the situation. Clarity is still not available on every aspect of the episode

title: The hands behind the golu dolls of Bommaikara Theru in Kancheepuram
content: Asthagiri street, known as Bommaikara Theru, in Kancheepuram was once filled with doll makers whose craft defined Navaratri. Today, only a handful of families remain, balancing tradition with changing demand and rising expenses.

title: The anxious, ‘absent’ migrant voters of Gopalganj
content: Gopalganj district has the highest number of names deleted from the draft electoral list, with voters declared ‘absent’ or ‘permanently shifted’, though many migrants still want to register as electors

title: Bhanumathi: a multi-faceted star of Tamil, Telugu cinema
content: Bhanumathi was not just about acting. She directed and produced 16 films and wrote screenplays, dialogues, and scripts. She composed music. She sang all the songs in her films and included one keerthana of Thyagaraja mostly in her Telugu movies

title: Swades Foundation reshaping rural India through mindset change
content: Guided by the motto, ‘Swa Se Bane Des’ or ‘I make my own country,’ the Foundation today works across over 1,300 villages across Maharashtra, building a model of empowerment that is sustainable, and community led

title: TMC charges Union Minister and BJP leader with disrespecting Rabindranath Tagore’s photograph
content: TMC highlighted a photograph of the poet which was allegedly placed at the feet of  Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar. The BJP leader said that the portrait of the poet was not placed on the stage but at a distance

title: Police diary with no specific acts cannot be ground to detain a person: Jammu and Kashmir High Court quashes PSA
content: The advocates who appeared for the accused informed the court that the entire material forming the basis of the grounds of detention “was neither supplied nor explained to him in the language he understands”

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court notice to government authorities over death of infants after rat bites at Indore hospital
content: On August 30 and 31, the two girls were gnawed upon by rats inside the NICU of the MY Hospital, one of Madhya Pradesh’s largest government-run medical facility

title: Railway Minister announces parcel train to transport apples from Kashmir to Delhi
content: The move comes as a relief to orchardists in south Kashmir, where hundreds of trucks laden with apple produce worth ₹200 crore are stranded due to the closure of the Srinagar-Jammu national highway for the past 13 days following landslips triggered by heavy rains

title: Supreme Court upholds Bar Council’s fee for All India Bar Examination
content: Petitioner claims the fee charged by BCI was in violation of Section 24(1) (f) of Advocates Act, 1961 and infringed on the fundamental rights under Articles 19(1)(g) and 14 of Constitution

title: Standard of debates in legislatures, Parliament should improve: Om Birla
content: The Lok Sabha Speaker urges lawmakers to rise above party lines on issues of national interest and meet the aspirations of people

title: Semiconductors are silent engines driving innovation, says APSCHE chief
content: The government is eager to harness the semiconductor frontier through India-centric innovation, strategic collaboration, and a future-ready infra, says Madhu Murthy

title: Special Cabinet meeting on September 16 to discuss UKP-III
content: State government to arrive at a decision on land acquisition for the project; the government intends to provide justice to the farmers, says H.K. Patil

title: A.P. Governor calls for lifelong learning at Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham convocation
content: Nazeer lauds the institution’s achievements in global rankings, sustainability initiatives, and international research collaborations

title: 144 Telugus stranded in Nepal return to A.P.
content: Of the total, 104 people alights at Visakhaptnam airport; the flight continue its journey to Tirupati with the remaining 40 passengers

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Donald Trump's security tightened

title: Indian Railways focusing on providing more connectivity to North Eastern States
content: Indian Railways has taken up several projects in the hilly terrains connecting the capital cities of Manipur and Nagaland, say officials

title: Structures erected to greet Modi pulled down in Manipur’s Churachandpur
content: Earlier, Kuki-Zo bodies welcomed the Prime Minister’s visit but opposed the inclusion of a dance programme in the official function

title: The invisible children in Chengara’s protest land
content: Around 200 children live in abominable conditions in Chengara, the site of a long-standing protest in Kerala, a State that takes pride in its child development indices. The settlement lacks electricity, piped water connections, and proper roads. K.S. Sudhi and Hiran Unnikrishnan chronicle the plight of these children.

title: Diarrhoea cases in Vijayawada go up to 102, no clarity yet on causes
content: No deaths reported, says Minister; reports of water samples sent to Institute of Preventive Medicine awaited; control room set up at the Collectorate

title: SSB detains 63 Nepal prison escapees; some claim to be Indians
content: A woman inmate who was apprehended at Kishanganj along the Bihar border was handed over to the police

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes Chief Justices to three High Courts
content: The Collegium has recommended Justice Soumen Sen as Chief Justice of Meghalaya High Court; Patna HC Acting Chief Justice P.B. Bajanthri was recommended as its regular Chief Justice; Justice M. Sundar was recommended as the Chief Justice of Manipur High Court

title: C.P. Radhakrishnan to take oath as the new Vice-President on September 12
content: Mr. Radhakrishnan, according to sources, has also called a meeting of all floor leaders of Rajya Sabha

title: Ayyankuzhi families vacate lodge, claim BPCL-KR has agreed to pay rent
content: Oil company dismisses families’ claim, says no concrete commitments were given either in terms of rent or potential land acquisition

title: ‘Vote chori’ scripted abroad, alleges BJP; ‘ridiculous’, says Congress
content: BJP claimed that it had “undeniable” technical proof that power-point presentation made by Rahul Gandhi to allege vote theft had been created abroad

title: Government contemplates raising civil border guards along China border
content: Border Wing Home Guards, paid and treated as constables, are now active only in Rajasthan; used for information collection, dissemination during Operation Sindoor; may be used to support ITBP along China border

title: Amit Shah launches faster immigration clearance programme at 5 more airports
content: The facility will enhance travellers’ convenience for Indian citizens and Overseas Citizen of India cardholders, says the Union Home Minister

title: Top Maoist among 10 killed in Chhattisgarh encounter
content: Manoj alias Modem Balakrishna carried a bounty of ₹1 crore; operation was carried out by the State Police and elite CoBRA unit of the CRPF

title: Fadnavis slams Karnataka CM over renaming of Bengaluru Metro station
content: Siddaramaiah has proposed to rename Shivaji Nagar Metro station in Bengaluru as St. Mary station; ‘history will not forgive you’, ally Shiv Sena UBT warns Congress

title: Three-month-long Champions Boat League to begin on September 19
content: The 2025 edition will feature 14 races in as many places. Inaugural race will be at the Pampa in Kainakary in Alappuzha district while the finals will be at Ashtamudi Lake in Kollam on December 6

title: Pilgrimage travel emerges as a fast-growing segment: MakeMyTrip
content: Accommodation bookings across 56 destinations rose 19% in FY24; premiumisation and group travel gaining ground

title: T.N. to move SC over TET judgment, says School Education Minister
content: TET should remain a compulsory requirement for future appointments; the retrospective application of this requirement to teachers who were already in service has created a grave concern, says Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi

title: Educated youth were forced to migrate as political class thrived, say Nepali nationals in Bengaluru
content: ‘People are sending money from Bengaluru, but those in Nepal are not receiving it because the servers have stopped working’

title: Nitish Kumar government will be formed once again to serve people of Bihar: Piyush Goyal
content: The Union Minister asserts that Opposition INDIA bloc may declare anyone as CM candidate, but no one can stand in front of Nitish

title: Greens seek probe into ‘illegal survey’  inside Malabar Wildlife Sanctuary
content: The Chief Wildlife Warden has allowed only a drone-based survey, barring ground-level GPS work, machinery movement, or physical entry into the sanctuary, says Wayanad Prakruti Samrakshana Samithi president

title: Akola riots 2023 case | Police officers must shed communal colours when they put on their uniforms, says Supreme Court
content: The top court directs action against police who ignored a teenage Muslim assault victim and eyewitness to murder during the 2023 Akola communal riots and orders probe by SIT comprising Muslim and Hindu officers

title: SIET to organise Aksharakoottu literary festival for children
content: On Kanakakkunnu Palace premises on September 18 and 19.  Festival intended to encourage students with an interest in literary pursuits and give them an insight into literature and language

title: In death, Isaac gives new life to six persons
content: Heart of braindead restaurateur from Kottarakara transplanted into Angamaly native and his kidneys, liver and corneas have also been donated

title: Postal ballots for NRI voters may turn a reality soon
content: Chief Electoral Officer, Kerala, Rathan U. Kelkar says his office has urged the ECI to introduce the facility for the upcoming 2026 Assembly elections in the State

title: Rajnath Singh flags off ‘Samudra Pradakshina’, world’s first tri-service all-women circumnavigation sailing expedition
content: According to Ministry of Defence, over the next nine months, 10 women officers from the Army, Navy and Air Force will sail onboard the indigenously-built Indian Army Sailing Vessel (IASV) Triveni

title: Wayanad chamber to seek Priyanka’s support for cable car project, bypasses
content: The MP is expected to visit the site of the proposed Padinjarathara-Poozhithode bypass on September 12, 2025

title: 'This place belongs to us': Netanyahu vows 'there'll be no' Palestinian state
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Pig farms in Thiruvananthapuram found burying large amounts of waste on their premises
content: In April, the Kerala State Commission for Protection of Child Rights has directed the authorities of three grama panchayats in the district to close down pig farms functioning without valid licences in unhygienic surroundings and causing pollution

title: National conference of gynaec surgeons in Thrissur
content: Three-day SOVSICON-25 to bring together 500 doctors. Workshops on vaginal surgery and cosmetic gynaecology to be held

title: Fete to celebrate quality and excellence in higher education
content: Excellencia 2025, scheduled to be held on September 15, 16 in Thiruvananthapuram, will honour top institutions, devise strategies to improve quality of education

title: Veteran Congress leader and former Speaker P.P. Thankachan passes away
content: His passing at 87 brings the curtains down on a momentous political career that spanned almost five decades.

title: Ahead of elections, BJP steps up engagement with Christian community
content: Outreach with all communities, including Christians, will be expanded to the grassroots level  ahead of the upcoming elections. Committees will be formed at both the Assembly and panchayat levels to enable this,  says  Shone George, BJP State vice-president

title: Army conducts drone integration exercise in tactical ops during Exercise Siyom Prahar
content: Three-day field training drill tested unmanned aerial systems for surveillance, targeting and precision strikes

title: Browns' Delpit: 'Not hard' to bring down Henry
content: a year ago, the Cleveland Browns hammered Derrick Henry with a big hit . he got off to a strong start this season with 169 yards rushing . but the Browns have had success against him .

title: Experts' picks and best bet: How can Crawford upset Canelo?
content: if he beats Canelo, he will become the first fighter in men's boxing to unify all four major belts in three divisions . he defeated Caleb Plant by 11th-round TKO in November 2021 to become undisputed champion at 168 pounds . the IBF stripped him for not fighting mandatory challenger William Scull .

title: How the NYPD and FDNY honor 9/11 with football, 20 years on
content: cops and firemen heckled each other nonstop from the opening kiwi . they were playing in observance of the 20th anniversary of 9/11 . the two football teams had lost too many people on that day . but they did not put aside their rivalry .

title: Bottom 10: The spitting distance between Florida and Arizona State
content: "Wounded arms must carry the load" is spitting off the edge of the world, out in the night . "spitting off the Edge of the World" is here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . Pat McAfee donates all the sleeves that he cuts off his shred .

title: Connelly's Premier League 'ifs' list: How contenders can come together to win it all
content: don Hutchison believes there will be competition for a spot in Liverpool's starting lineup . we can all actually now give our full attention to reasons why most of us enjoy soccer: the actual games . 16 of 20 premier league teams have between two and six points, and even the team that won its first three matches .

title: Nepal unrest: Tourist bus with Indians attacked in Kathmandu; deadlock over interim govt continues
content: When not covering crime, he reads fiction, roams around the dark alleys of the city in the dead of night. An MA (English Litt) from University of Lucknow, Pathikrit loves to speak French, well at least a smattering of it. He did his graduation in French language. A recipient of the Road Safety Fellowship of the United Nations, Pathikrit drives cautiously and advises others to do that too. title: Kraft's 57-yard reception sets up Green Bay TD
content: GREEN BAY, Wis. -- The  Washington Commanders  and the  Green Bay Packers  are facing off on Thursday Night Football at Lambeau Field. Both teams won their Week 1 matchups against the  New York Giants  and  Detroit Lions , respectively, and are looking more Thursday. Our two team reporters -- John Keim for the Commanders and Rob Demovsky for the Packers -- are at Lambeau, and they're keeping you updated on all the biggest plays and highlights. Here are the highlights from the game.

title: Follow live: Commanders take on Packers in Green Bay
content: 2nd & 2   WSH 30 Prime Video 82   Total Yards 274 0   Turnovers 0 4   1st Downs 13 3-20   Penalties 4-40 2/7   3rd Down 3/6 0/0   4th Down 0/1 0/0   Red Zone 2/2 12:10   Possession 17:46 Green Bay ,  WI   64 ° Back Judge : Greg Yette Side Judge : David Meslow Down Judge : Patrick Turner Umpire : Bryan Neale Line Judge : Kevin Codey Referee : Brad Rogers Field Judge : Joe Blubaugh Current Drive 2 plays, 22 yards, 0:10 Timeout #1 by GB at 00:04.
